title: Suggest .unwrap() if an Ok(T) would satisfy a trait bound for a Result

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=392c19dc37977bcacdcad6b4f47d9c4e

```rust
use anyhow::Error;

trait T {}
struct S {}
impl T for S {}

fn foo(_: impl T) {}

fn main() {
    let r: Result<S, Error> = Ok(S {});
    foo(r);
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0277): the trait bound `Result<S, anyhow::Error>: T` is not satisfied
  --> src/main.rs:11:9
   |
11 |     foo(r);
   |     --- ^ the trait `T` is not implemented for `Result<S, anyhow::Error>`
   |     |
   |     required by a bound introduced by this call
   |
   = help: the trait `T` is implemented for `S`
note: required by a bound in `foo`
  --> src/main.rs:7:16
   |
7  | fn foo(_: impl T) {}
   |                ^ required by this bound in `foo`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
```

Ideally the output would include a suggestion to use `r.unwrap()` if `Ok(r)` would satisfy the trait bound.
